text: Andrew Ira Brooks (February 10, 1969January 23, 2021) was an American immunologist, academic, and businessman. He was an associate research professor at Rutgers University. He created the first FDA-approved rapid saliva test for COVID-19 diagnosis. Brooks died on January 23, 2021 from a heart attack in New York City, aged 51. ==References== Category:1969 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American immunologists Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Scientists from New York City
title: Andrew Brooks
